pipeline: PaM Info RVI viral metagenomics pipeline

monochrome_logs.help_text: Should logs appear in plain ASCII

human_read_removal.help_text: enables the human-read removal functionality using Kneaddata software; Trimmomatic trimming will then take place as part of the Kneaddata process

off_target_db.help_text: off-target genome database for contamination read removal; defaults to the human genome

metaspades_base_mem_gb.help_text: memmory in GB from which the METASPADES process will start iterating, doubling at every retry when failed for insufficient memory

skip_qc_abundance_estimation.help_text:
Skip or enable read data clean-up including off-target (default: human host contaminant) read removal with metaWRAP QC as a prior step to ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:INSTRAIN subworkflow? [default: true i.e. skip]
                                NB: this off-target/host-contamination removal step is mostly redundant with upstream filtering with Kneaddata (when setting `--human_read_removal true`).

genome_dir_abundance_estimation.help_text: folder of reference genome database for read mapping with Bowtie2 as a prior step to ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:INSTRAIN subworkflow

sourmash_db_abundance_estimation.help_text: Sourmash index of reference genomes for read mapping with Bowtie2 as a prior step to ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:INSTRAIN subworkflow

publish_host_reads_abundance_estimation.help_text:
Should host reads detected by metaWRAP QC (as a prior step to ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:INSTRAIN subworkflow) be saved? [default: false] (optional)
                               NB: there shouldn't be much or any such reads when filtering upstream with Kneaddata (with `--human_read_removal true`).

bmtagger_db_abundance_estimation.help_text: location of BMTAGGER database for off-target read removal (as part of the ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:METAWRAP_QC subworkflow)

bmtagger_host_abundance_estimation.help_text: BMTAGGER database for off-target read removal (as part of the ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION:METAWRAP_QC subworkflow); default to human genome assembly T2T-CHM13v2.0

cleanup_intermediate_files_abundance_est.help_text: Should possibly large and numerous intermediate files from the ABUNDANCE_ESTIMATION workflow be removed on the fly from the work/ folder? (prevents use of the -resume functionality for this workflow)

cleanup_intermediate_files_irods_extract.help_text: delete intermediate CRAM files downloaded from IRODS in work/ folder

preexisting_fastq_tag.help_text:
if the expected ouput fastq files exist in the folder named like this under the result folder for the sample e.g. in results/12345_1#67/trimmed_reads/12345_1#67_1.fastq.gz,
            then skip download and any further processing for this sample. Default value 'trimmed_reads' means the run skips items for which the output for the PREPROCESSING subworkflow already exists.

split_sep_for_ID_from_fastq.help_text: separator to recognise sample ID from preexisting file.
